meanings.definition: To make or become Japanese in character, style, or influence.
meanings.sent1: She japanized her wardrobe by adding traditional kimonos.
meanings.sent2: The foreign restaurant japanized its menu to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The cat japanized itself by sleeping in a cozy futon.
meanings.sent4: His music was japanized with the soothing sounds of a koto.
meanings.sent5: The garden was japanized with beautiful cherry blossom trees.

meanings.definition: To adapt or conform to Japanese customs or practices.
meanings.sent1: He japanized quickly by bowing when greeting others.
meanings.sent2: The students japanized to the school's strict uniform policy.
meanings.sent3: The dog japanized by sitting politely during tea ceremonies.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was japanized with intricate origami designs.
meanings.sent5: The town was japanized with colorful lanterns during the festival.
